page.title: 14Village Hall.
page.content: The Village Hall,which had been the old village school,was re-opened on the 18th.May 1985.It has been re-roofed,re-decorated,a new heating system,new toilets and a new floor put in. In 1982 the Hall needed repairing so the Old Dalby Community Association (O.D.C.A.)was formed.O.D.C.A. had three choices about where to have a new hall.Finally they chose to buy the old Village Hall.They got money from the Rural County Council,Melton Borough Council,the Parish Council and raised a quarter of the cost (Â£5,000) themselves.They raised the money by holding fairs,dances,concerts,raffles, sponsored walks,a marathon,coffee mornings and money given by the Old Dalby Quilters.The Hall should become the centre for all village activities.
